ygData.subject: Re: Powerleveling doesnt mean L50 + rant
ygData.msgSnippet: Wow.  That s the most pessimistic post I ve seen from you!  Looks like it may be time for you to move on I m sorry to say.  I ask you why you would punish
ygData.messageBody:
Wow. That's the most pessimistic post I've seen from you! Looks like it may be time for you to move on
I'm sorry to say. I ask you why you would punish yourself further by playing the game if you're really
that bored with it? What I would do is cancel my account, then start it up again when the expansion gets
released to see if it's any good. They don't delete your characters. Vote with your wallet. There are a
lot of other nice games out there to play.

I guess my point is, why would someone play a game when they are completely bored with it? That kindof
defeats the purpose. I know we all want more, and MORE of what we love, which is EQ. But if there is no
more to be had, throwing money at the vendor doesn't help. It's like buying apples, and when the vendor
is sold out of apples, handing him $10 and demanding apples because you paid him for apples and dammit,
you had better give me more apples or I'll get irate and flame you on the internet. "Uh, but sir. We
don't have any more apples."

Not to get your hackles up Ryan. This is certainly not directed specifically at you. :)

Laluni Songhammer of E'Ci

Ryan Honeyman wrote:

> A GM once visited us in the Plane of Fear. His words stick in my mind.
>
> -- "It's all going downhill from here" --
>
> I've yet to see that proven wrong since then.
>
> Harmonic, the disillusioned.
>

--
Steven S. Klug
sklug@...
